Basler controller¶

BOTH THE FILE AND THE DOCUMENTATION ARE INCOMPLETE

class labphew.controller.basler.basler_controller.BaslerCamera(camera)[source]¶

Bases: labphew.core.base.camera_base.BaseCamera

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

_acquisition_mode = 0¶
finalize()[source]¶
get_ROI()[source]¶
get_acquisition_mode()[source]¶

Returns the acquisition mode, either continuous or single shot.

get_auto_exposure()[source]¶

Auto exposure can take one of three values: Off, Once, Continuous

get_auto_gain()[source]¶

Auto Gain must be one of three values: Off, Once, Continuous

get_ccd_height()[source]¶
get_ccd_width()[source]¶
get_exposure()[source]¶

The exposure of the camera defined in microseconds

get_frame_asarray()[source]¶
get_gain()[source]¶

Gain is a float

get_pixel_format()[source]¶

Pixel format must be one of Mono8, Mono12, Mono12p

initialize()[source]¶

Initializes the communication with the camera. Get’s the maximum and minimum width. It also forces the camera to work on Software Trigger.

Warning

It may be useful to integrate other types of triggers in applications that need to synchronize with other hardware.

read_camera() → list[source]¶

Reads the camera

set_ROI(vals)[source]¶

Sets up the ROI. Not all cameras are 0-indexed, so this is an important place to define the proper ROI.

Parameters:
  • X (list) – array type with the coordinates for the ROI X[0], X[1]
  • Y (list) – array type with the coordinates for the ROI Y[0], Y[1]
Returns:

X, Y lists with the current ROI information
set_acquisition_mode(mode)[source]¶

Set the readout mode of the camera: Single or continuous. :param int mode: One of self.MODE_CONTINUOUS, self.MODE_SINGLE_SHOT :return:

set_auto_exposure(mode: str)[source]¶
set_auto_gain(mode)[source]¶
set_exposure(exposure)[source]¶

The exposure of the camera is defined in microseconds

set_gain(gain: float)[source]¶

Sets the gain on the camera, if possible

Parameters:gain – a float representing the gain
set_pixel_format(mode)[source]¶

Pixel format must be one of Mono8, Mono12, Mono12p

start_free_run()[source]¶

Starts a free run from the camera. It will preserve only the latest image. It depends on how quickly the experiment reads from the camera whether all the images will be available or only some.

stop_camera()[source]¶

Stops the acquisition and closes the connection with the camera.

stop_free_run()[source]¶
trigger_camera()[source]¶

Triggers the camera.
